title: Odd input delay (lag but not?)
body:
So ever since the last soft-patch (since world finals) I have been getting these random moments of what appears to be lag however it has been consistent in all of my games, the ping in the top right maintains a consistent 75~ ping that does not flux at all either during or after the "spike" however all input seems delayed anywhere from 1 sec to 2 seconds. Although I noticed in this past game that it seems as though I can still see everyone's movements in real-time, it is just response. Although when the delay gets bad (2 secs or more) I get "reconnecting."
Not sure if I should reinstall or where to start diagnosing the cause since initial tests are showing my internet is not the issue (good ping, and internet test coming strong)

replies.body: Having the same issue, will keep in touch if I find out anything

You might be having packet loss, which can cause input delay.  Run a [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) to get an analysis of your network during these matches to know for sure.  Let me know what you find!

So based on the symptoms, I concluded the problem is either a bug/error with the latest patch- so I am reinstalling my client however during the "lag spikes" I was told that my mic/coms were breaking up (on skype and then on discord) so I continued to look for other issues and I believe I found it!
I don't normally look at this but my Upload speed was only 1.5 mbps; which would make sense considering I am able to see what is happening in game despite the "lag input" symptom. 
Now why my upload speed is so low I can only speculate however I tried the following troubleshooting:
1. Reset router/Modem
2. Connected device directly to router (cut out wi-fi)
3. Turned off Large IPv4/6 offloading
4. Checked firmware on router and Ethernet driver updates
5. QoS optimization

Through all this, nothing changed.

Then I noticed I had enabled manual DHCP assignment and set the MAC address of my PC to 199 (192.168.0.199) - however since I had changed from wi-fi to direct lan, I figured I'd remove that. Then I noticed I also set the available pool for DHCP from 192.168.0.2 ~ 192.168.0.198, while reading someone had mentioned checking the DHCP range to have 2-3 digits in minimum range. I corrected this and now am getting over 10mbps upload speed (and my download speed improved to 180 mbps hehe) downloaded the game over again in under 30 mins.
I will update this tomorrow when I get a chance to play a few games and see if the issue is resolved.
